title: Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site: People
body: People         John Olmsted (Olmsted's Father) with their dog Neptune Courtesy of Historic New England  Fairsted was both a home and an office. On these pages, get to know some of the many people who walked the floors and grounds of this place and others who played a role in the Olmsted story.  Frederick Law Olmsted moved here with his family: his wife, Mary; his daughter, Marion; and his sons, John Charles and Frederick Jr.  Olmsted and his sons also worked alongside other landscape architects and employees in the office wing.
